sent_inference: I enjoy going sailing with my father.
I don't like eating out at upscale places.
The movie was funny or sad.
Some of the players were skillful.
Two of the cookies were chocolate.
sent_manipulation: John spends a lot of time with his family.
John has only seen one or two football games.
Bob goes to the bakery every day.
John has no interest in fashion or clothes.
John does not care that much about his students and doesn't get to know them.
Bob watches the weather channel every day.
sent_context: John and Bob were talking about sailing yesterday.
John and Bob were talking about restaurants yesterday.
Yesterday, John and Bob were talking about a movie at the local theater.
Last week, John and Bob were talking about the football game.
A few days ago, John and Bob were talking about cookies at a local bakery.
Last month, Bob and John were talking about a shirt at a local store.
A year ago, Bob and John were talking about the students in a class they taught.
Bob and John were talking about the weather during the previous weekend.
expt_aim: to see how we perceive the sentence

the students were not always tired?
